gurmukhi: ੳੁਠੰਤ ਭੳੁਰ ਭੂਰਣੋ ਕਢੰਤ ਭੈਕਰੀ ਸੁਰੰ ॥ ਭਜੰਤ ਭੀਰ ਭੈਕਰੰ ਬਜੰਤ ਬੀਰ ਸੁ ਪ੍ਰਭੰ ॥
transliteration: Ueehant Bhaur Bhoorno Kadhant Bhaikarisuran|| Bhajant Bheer Bhaikaran Bajant Beer Su Prabhan||
translation: The warriors rotating while roaming, are raising dreadful sounds; seeing the glory of the warriors, the cowards are running away;

gurmukhi: ਤੁਟੰਤ ਤਾਲ ਤੱਥਿਯੰ ਨਚੰਤ ੲੀਸ੍ਰਣੋ ਰਣੰ ॥ ਖਹੰਤ ਖਿਤ੍ਰਣੋ ਖਗੰ ਨਿਨੱਦਿ ਗੱਦਿ ਘੁੰਘਰੰ ॥੨੧੫॥
transliteration: Toutant Taal Tathhiyan Nachannd Eesrano Ranan|| Khahant Khitrano Khagadg Ninadd(i) Gad(i) Ghounghran||215||
translation: Shiva is engaged in Tandava dance and the daggers are colliding with one another producing various types of sounds.215.

gurmukhi: ਭਜੰਤ ਅਾਸੁਰੀ ਸੁਤੰ ੳੁਠੰਤ ਭੈ ਕਰੀ ਧੁਣੰ ॥ ਚਲੰਤ ਤੀਛਣੋ ਸਰੰ ਸਿਲੇਣ ੳੁੱਜਲੀ ਕ੍ਰਿਤੰ ॥
transliteration: Bhajant Aasurisoutan Outhant Bhai Karidhounan|| Chalant Teechhano Saran Silen Ujjalikritan||
translation: The sons of the demons, getting, frightened are running away and the sharp arrows are being discharged on them;

gurmukhi: ਨਚੰਤ ਰੰਗ ਜੋਗਣੰ ਚਚੱਕਿ ਚੳੁਦਣੋ ਦਿਸੰ ॥ ਕਪੰਤ ਕੁੰਦਨੋ ਗਿਰੰ ਤ੍ਰਿਸੰਤ ਸਰਬਤੋ ਦਿਸੰ ॥੨੧੬॥
transliteration: Nachannd Ran Jogadan Chachakk(i) Chaudado Disan|| Kapant Koundano Giran Trisant Sarbado Disan||216||
translation: The Yoginis are dancing in the fourteen directions and the Sumeru mountain are trembling.216.

gurmukhi: ਨਚੰਤ ਕੀਰ ਬਾਵਣੰ ਖਹੰਤ ਬਾਹਣੀ ਧੁਜੰ ॥ ਬਰੰਤ ਅੱਛ੍ਰਣੋ ਭਟੰ ਪ੍ਰਬੀਨ ਚੀਨ ਸੁ ਪ੍ਰਭੰ ॥
transliteration: Nachannd Keer Baavadan Khakant Baahanidhujan|| Barant Achchhrano Bhatan Prabeen Cheen Su Prabhan||
translation: All the warriors of Shiva are dancing and the heavenly damsels, after recognizing the fierce fighters are wedding them;

gurmukhi: ਬਕੰਤ ਡੳੁਰ ਡਾਮਰੀ ਅਨੰਤ ਤੰਤ੍ਰਣੋ ਰਿਸੰ ॥ ਹਸੰਤ ਜੱਛ ਗੰਧ੍ਰਬੰ ਪਿਸਾਚ ਭੂਤ ਪ੍ਰੇਤਨੰ ॥੨੧੭॥
transliteration: Bakant Daur Daamarianant Tantrano Risan|| Hasant Jachchh Gaddhraban Pisaach Pretanan|| 217||
translation: The witches in their fury are shouting and the yaskshas, gandharvas, imps, ghosts, fiends etc. are laughing.217.

gurmukhi: ਭਰੰਤ ਚੁੰਚ ਚਾਵਡੀ ਭਛੰਤ ਫਿਕ੍ਰਣੀ ਤਨੰ ॥ ਡਕੰਤ ਡਾਕਣੀ ਡੁਲੰ ਡਰੰਤ ਪਤ੍ਰ ਸ੍ਰੋਣਤੰ ॥
transliteration: Bharant Chounch Chaavadibhachhant Phikranitanan|| Dakant Daakanidulan Darant Patra Sronatan||
translation: The vultures flying and revolving, are devouring flesh and the vampires are drinking blood, filling it in their bowls;

gurmukhi: ਪਿਪੰਤਯਾ ਸਵੰ ਸੁਭੰ ਹਸੰਤ ਮਾਰਜਨੀ ਮ੍ਰਿੜੰ ॥ ਅਟੁਟ ਹਾਸਣੋ ਹਸੰ ਖਿਮੰਤ ੳੁੱਜਲੌੰ ਅਸੰ ॥੨੧੮॥
transliteration: Pipantayaa Savan Soubhan Hasant Maarjanimridan|| Atout Haasano Hasan Khimant Ujjlau Asan||218||
translation: The female ghosts and fiends are laughing while drinking blood and the luster of the swords is being seen and the continued laughter is being heard in the battlefield.218.

transliteration: Joutte Vderan|| Chhoutte Tderan|| Jujjhe Taajee|| Dihhe Gadjee||219||
translation: The warriors fought, the arrows were discharged, the horses died and the fighters fell down.219.

transliteration: Bajje Juaanan|| Baahe Baanan|| Rujjhe Janadg|| Jujhe Anadg||220||
translation: The soldiers discharging their arrows and being absorbed in the war are fighting with various limbs.220.

transliteration: Toutte Tanadg|| Phoutte Anadg|| Sajje Sooran|| Ghoommihooran||221||
translation: The swords are broken, the limbs are heavenly damsels are roaming for wedding them.221.

transliteration: Jujjhe Haathi|| Rujjhe Saathee|| Oubbhe Oustan|| Soubbhe Poustan||222||
translation: The elephants are engaged in fighting with other elephants; the camels, very high, are absorbed in fighting with other powerful camels.222.

transliteration: Phatte Bderan|| Chhoutte Tderan|| Digge Bhooman|| Outthe Ghooman||223||
translation: With the discharge of arrows, the warriors being chopped are falling on the ground; they are getting up again.223.
